book.part:
JasperReports Integration
A Reporting tool that shows various open source contents in PDF, HTML, XLS, CSV, etc. form. Overall, it is written in java, and can be used by various applications to create contents in many formats. You can develop a design in XML format, compile it, and by binding data with RDBMS and JDBC, create various reports.
The characteristics of JasperReports are as follows:
Provides various reporting output forms (PDF, HTML, XLS, CSV, etc.)
Composes reporting data using various data sources.
Can report in various layouts, and provides a graphical view that includes charts.
Provides graphical report designer. (Various tools can be used for free or for charge.)
The following figure shows the entire process from designing the report of XML format, to creating the final result report with JasperRepoting Engine.
Developer can implement Reporting easily after developing business component by providing tools that create Jasper XML(jrxml) file. JasperReports described in this manual (http://jasperforge.org/projects/jasperreports) gives examples based on integration with Spring MVC. The Reporting function provided by Anyframe basically provides JasperReports functions, but because it is integrated with Spring MVC, there can be some JasperReports functions that are not provided through Spring MVC. In this case, an extended form of Spring MVC can be implemented if necessary.
For instance, the following cases are included:
HTML file Reporting - View class provided by Spring MVC is extended to display image file within HTML.
If you use the Reporting function after installing Anyframe, you can use the above functions without additional coding when following the guidelines in this manual.
Install JasperReports according to the following, design JRXML, and execute sample application.
&jasperreports_integration_configuration; &jasperreports_integration_controller;
